title: Figma Unveils Three AI-Powered Tools for Precise Image Editing, Streamlining Designer Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma has launched three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—designed to enable precise edits directly within the platform without exporting to external software.These features integrate into a unified toolbar alongside existing options like background removal and crop, addressing common designer pain points such as object manipulation and aspect ratio adjustments.Announced on December 10, 2025, the tools use an upgraded lasso for selections and require no text prompts, prioritizing granular control.

primarySource.name: Figma Blog
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: theaiinsider
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: The tools allow users to remove unwanted elements while preserving background details, isolate subjects for repositioning or effects like lighting and color tweaks, and extend images to new formats without distortion.Available now in Figma Design and Draw for Full seat users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, they reduce reliance on rivals like Photoshop.A promotional video highlights how these capabilities keep all editing in one file, enhancing efficiency for marketing assets and UI mockups.

primarySource.name: techcrunch
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: youtube
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase, Isolate, and Expand Capabilities

paragraphs.content: The **Erase object** tool lets designers lasso and delete elements, with AI filling in backgrounds while maintaining lighting and shadows.**Isolate object** separates subjects for movement or adjustments like blur, color correction, and focus via a sidebar, without altering the rest of the image.Figma's blog notes these address finessing details for device sizes and marketing materials, closing workflow loops previously requiring multiple tools.

primarySource.name: contentgrip
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: oreateai
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: **Expand image** intelligently extends backgrounds to fit new aspect ratios, such as turning square product shots into landscape banners.This preserves image integrity for social media or web assets, eliminating constant cropping.The unified toolbar consolidates these with annotations and background changes, spotlighting frequent actions like removal for brand consistency.

primarySource.name: figma
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

additionalSources.name: youtube
additionalSources.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

sections.title: Availability, Rollout Plans, and Competitive Edge

paragraphs.content: Features rolled out in Figma Design and Draw, with platform-wide expansion planned for 2026, per release notes emphasizing 150+ innovations in 2025.Tech coverage praises the lasso upgrades for prompt-free precision, positioning Figma to catch up with Adobe and Canva's long-standing object tools.Oreate AI calls it revolutionary for one-click actions and real-time previews, benefiting UI/UX pros and novices alike.

primarySource.name: figma
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: Figma plans future video frame-level removal, building on current AI credits system shared across features.Industry analysts note alignment with Adobe's ChatGPT integrations, though no Figma extension confirmed yet.These tools empower content teams for faster variations, minimizing design handoffs.
